intro: Tarenna tsangii f. elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic tarenna, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its elliptical-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand and Vietnam. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
